1. Go here. 2. Pass it on. 1.~How did you meet ambientboi? Through RyePride 2.~What would you do if you had never met ambientboi? Cry :o( 3.~What do you honestly think of ambientboi? He's a delicate flower. 4.~Would or did ambientboi and ambientboi go out? I don't want to think about that. 5.~Have you ever liked ambientboi? I have a mad crush on him. 6.~If kriss_41 died tomorrow, what is one thing that you would need him/her to know? That she's supercool. 7.~Would ambientboi and ambientboi make a good couple? Def not. 8.~Describe ambientboi in 3 words: A delicate flower. 9.~Do you think ambientboi is hot? Hot as a baked potato ;o) 10.~Would kriss_41 and ambientboi make a lovely couple? Hahahahahahaha. Maybe. 11.~What do you think of when you see ambientboi? A shining rainbow of shimmering sunshine. 12.~Tell me something humiliating about ambientboi: He's from Port Perry. (ha.) 13.~Do you know any of ambientboi's family members? Nope. 14.~What's ambientboi's favorite color? Black? 15.~On a scale of 1-10 how cute is ambientboi? 11 ;o) 16.~What would you do if ambientboi just professed their undying love for you? Plan our wedding. 17.~What language does ambientboi speak? Gregory! tongues. 18.~Who is ambientboi going out with? Me on Thursday. 19.~Is ambientboi a boy or a girl? A boy, silly! 20.~Would ambientboi and ambientboi make a good couple? Def not. Pay attention. 21.~Who do you think ambientboi would be great with from this list? Probably not Kriss. 22.~When was the last time you talked to ambientboi? A few days ago. 23.~What is ambientboi's favorite band? Garbage! 24.~Does ambientboi have any siblings? Yes. 2. 25.~Would you ever date ambientboi? Hah. Funny story... 26.~Would you ever date ambientboi? (see above). Pay attention! 27.~Is ambientboi single? Yes 28.~What is ambientboi's last name? Evans 29.~What is ambientboi's middle name? Allan 30~What is ambientboi's fantasy? To have cocktails with Shirley Manson? 31.~Where does ambientboi live? About 3 blocks away from me. 32.~Would you make out with ambientboi? Well he has licked my face before... that's the first step, right? 33.~Are ambientboi and ambientboi best friends? Bestest friends. 34.~Does ambientboi like ambientboi? I don't want to think about this. Pay attention. 35.~How did you meet ambientboi? Ugh. Pay attention. 36.~Is ambientboi older than you? No, although he is getting up there in years. 37.~Is ambientboi the sexiest person alive? Definitely!

1- Homosexuale?
2- Alanis...anything....especially old school "oh too hot never too cold...you take your best shot too hot to hold"
3- Green (I don't know why but I adamant about this)
4- moodle Nougat
5- Meeting you at Tangos with Sevan....
6- Dog...big tall Dalmation...that likes to sit on people's heads.

I couldn't have answered better myself... pretty accurate.  I forgot about Dylan sitting on your head though.  HahahahahahahahahaHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA...
I had some fun in photoshop.

I started the MySpace thingy on MSN.  It keeps me occupied when I'm extremely bored.  And now, when I'm bored with that, I come here.  :o)  So here I am.

Going to Sara's convocation tomorrow.  It will be long and exhausting, but I really want to go to see her graduate.  I will be taking pics outside and then she promised to stop by her lab with her gown on for everyone to see.

My grandparents emailed me today, which was a nice surprise.  I'm still not used to it though... 70-somethings being computer literate.  

Nothing much else going on, except starting to look for places.  I applied to a cool social work research job that I would really like to get.  Decent pay, too.  Keep your fingers crossed for me.

So I have the heads-up from my placement supervisor to go to Florida in October.  This's good news... I will get to see my dad's family after all.  And celebrate my grandfather's 80th birthday in a tropical climate.  Florida, look out: the pasty-white Canadians and British are coming!  And don't you worry, we will be bringing ample sunscreen to block any hint of a tan!  Bah ha.

In other news, I will be having company from Ottawa this weekend.  Sara is ditching me to go to Guelph.  I'll keep my ears peeled for attempted concealments of the door closing and locking at 4 am as the bf leaves.  *Shudder*.

People are stopping by with the landlady to scope out the apartment and it's a disaster.  I have finally taken it upon myself (after having several reasons to do so...ha) to CLEAN and organize the place.  I smell of cleaning products.

And it's June.

Happy Pride Month, everyone.  Debating whether or not to be a Dyke March Marshal / Security again and be useful or just watch.  The boycott of RyeSAC continues.  *High 5 Gregory!*  Splendid good times.

I would like very much to go to Tango tonight if people are going.  I have been a horrible hermit friend as of late (as of always) and I haven't been to a show in about a month.

Apologies are in order and a swift kick in the trousers for myself as well.

Inside Out is over.  It was fun while it lasted... I got to see 4 films and I met some cool people.  Sara and I took her mom and Sean to see "Women's Prison" yesterday.  It was in Farsi with English subtitles, and obviously the subtitles didn't do it any justice so we got the full story from Sara and her mom afterward.  Turns out the ending was super important and I'm sure NOBODY ELSE in the audience got it as there were NO OTHER Persian people there.  It's a good film, see it if you get a chance.  But be sure to have someone who understands Farsi nearby.  

Overall it was an interesting experience.  I'm sure Sara's mom was in lesbo-overload-mode after their little talk and the walk out of the theatre (which entailed hoards of hand-holding women with weird short hair).  Not to mention the Inside Out propaganda and the handouts ( Queer Black Women's Film Festival, etc).  I swear she looks at me with a different squint in her eye now.

My great-grandmother passed away a few days ago. She was a few weeks short of turning 100, but in her mind she was 102. So that's a pretty full life. She was sent to the hospital with pneumonia last weekend and was peacefully unconscious when she passed away.
Me, Grammy + Mom
My mom and my auntie Sharon were going to fly to New Brunswick to celebrate her big birthday next month, but they are now trying to change their tickets to get a flight to the funeral. My Grammy raised my mom and aunt in New Brunswick when their mom (my grandmother) moved to Toronto for work. I never got to meet my grandmother, she passed away before I was born. Grammy had lots of pictures of me in her room, but supposedly I look exactly like my grandmother did when she was young so I think she was confused. When my great-auntie Glenna retired, she turned her basement into an apartment for Grammy. She lived there until she moved into a nursing home a few years ago after falling and breaking her hip. My family used to drive to St. John to visit every other summer or so. I remember she even flew here with Glenna to visit once. My mom's family came to Canada from Denmark and chose to leave their language and much of their culture behind. They settled in New Brunswick and helped build the little town of New Denmark.
My mom and my auntie Sharon have lots of stories and memories of Grammy. It's sad that I didn't get to know her better.
Rest In Peace Grammy
1905 - 2005

Woo hoo!

Your #1 Match: INFJ

The Protector You live your life with integrity, originality, vision, and creativity. Independent and stubborn, you rarely stray from your vision - no matter what it is. You are an excellent listener, with almost infinite patience. You have complex, deep feelings, and you take great care to express them. You would make a great photographer, alternative medicine guru, or teacher.
What's Your Personality Type?

I picked up a few tech shifts at Inside Out from Krysta. This means that I will be at the festival 5 days in a row starting today. At least my free t-shirt will get lots of wear. I'm going out for sushi with Greg and his friends after his theatre group tonight, and then Sara and I are going to see "Crazy Town" (shorts). I finally get to see something! I will get to see the films that I'm working tech for, as well as getting a voucher for each shift. I saw Adam Jones during my last shift and he sucker-punched me in the kidneys. Hmph. I'll be able to see Pow! Wow! during my tech shift, but I will be working hard that night because both screenings are shorts and I have to help set up each film (21 in total). I hate headsets so that will be a treat. I spent all of Victoria Day weekend helping my mother mix soil and plant her flowers, while dogsitting for my brother at night. My mom picked me up for breakfast (mmm real food) and would drive me to my dad's sporadically throughout the day to pee the dog. Dylan is super confused by random family members stopping by and leaving again. My dad found a place in Saskatoon close to his work. I hope he likes it there and everything goes well. I have read a couple of books in the past few weeks (me? read?). "The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time" was charming, I recommend it to everyone who values truth in simplicity. I also read "Rubyfruit Jungle" and hated it. Horrible. Who has sex when they're in grade 6, and then sleeps with every woman they meet? Ugh. Horrible! Now I'm reading "The Scarlet Letter" for lack of better reading material. At least it's semi-interesting so far. Sara and I have kicked the DVD burner into high gear. We're getting our money's worth at 7-24... muah ha ha. Everyone must see "Blue Gate Crossing". BEST MOVIE EVERRR. How I love foreign films (it's from Taiwan). We have also gone through "Goldfish Memory" (cute Irish film from Inside Out last year), "Hedwig and the Angry Inch" (enough said), "Journey to Kafiristan" (HORRIBLE!!!), "High Art" (cut out the ending and it's great, although Ally Sheedy could be a little less creepy), and "Ma Vie En Rose" (classic). Fun. Finally got film for the old camera (colour this time) and will make a few trips out soon. Voila:
Your Sexy Brazilian Name Is
Gabriela Tavares
What's Your Sexy Brazilian Name?
I am on fire and I dance!

I sprung for the PC rather than the laptop. I don't think I would use a laptop to the extent that I use my PC... I wouldn't really take it anywhere with me and I don't like the small keys :oP I am also paranoid about fragile things. My dad left this morning for Saskatoon. He's driving there, around the Great Lakes, and staying in/near Thunder Bay tonight. *Shudder*. He doesn't have a place yet, which is so not like my dad, but I guess he's doing the same thing as when he moved to Canada. He will be working on the University of Saskatoon campus, which is cool. He seems excited about the change, and I think it's good for him. His contract is only 18 months, so he can decide where to go after it is up. He said he might move on to Calgary. Dave has the house to himself and is in charge of Dylan. I'm on dog duty this weekend (a great way to spend May 2-4, pffft) because he's going away with his friends. I got an odd (super-dykey) gift from my former boss in the mail. It's a Batman journal. Where do I begin... I also checked my marks last week, I suppose they are good except I did horribly in Social Policy. That was to be expected for several reasons. But I got an A+ in Anti-Oppression! :o) My first shift at Inside Out is on Friday. I'm super excited to see some of the stuff they have this year. I am a big fan of the compilations of shorts. One of them in the festival this year is curated by Adam Jones (friend/former RyePRIDE coord.)! It's called "Pow! Wow!". Yay for Ryerson students getting their stuff out there. My, this is a boring entry. I apologize. Here's an amusing picture to compensate:
This one is a few years old. We were taken aback by the visitors at Tango and Benny took a pic. Note Kris (orange shirt) in the background laughing and pretending to be posing for the pic.

So my hair is growing at an astronomical rate. Sara was having fun with it yesterday and I was posing enthusiastically:
Suave, no? I'm not sure how long I will let it weed out to. It already drives me crazy.

"Let me climb up you to the top
So I can see the view from up there
Tangled in your hair" ~DM

Dinner party 2nite!  I wonder what Sara's gonna wear.  :o)  I'm super excited but I'm still feeling a bit sick.  Go away cold!  *sniffle*  :o(

I'm making soup (again) and I have been sleeping excessively (even more excessively than usual) to try to kick it and I think it's on it's way out.

Mmm big spicy soup.  

My mom and I decided to go to Little Italy for Mother's Day instead.  We walked all the way across College past Ossington (into Little Portugal) looking at restaurants, and then turned around and ended up at Cafe Diplomatico (594 College).  It was really good, and there was a line for the patio so we figured it was a good choice.  We had been walking in the sun for a while so we ate inside.  Definitely a place to go back to... the pizza looked amazing and appropriate for accompanying a few beers on their patio.

It's always a good time exploring with my mom.  She has these stories about moving all over the city and how the neighbourhoods used to be.  She used to work at the Esso station at Dupont and Dovercourt when she was really young.  Is it still there?  She also spoke of electric streetcar-like buses on Ossington.  Cool beans.  We stopped to gaze at a super long "true" laneway... I will definitely take my camera back there.  

We walked back through Kensington Market (mostly everything was closed, it was Sunday) and Chinatown.

Just got back from going to the 2nd straight club in my life.  Interesting.  Charlene escorted Greg and I (ha!) to Havana, where we not only got in for free, but got free drinks.  Greg didn't finish his, so I did.  I couldn't help but look at the women instead of the men... but can you blame me?  Not that there was anything to look at.  It was so weird to have men look at me, even if I gave them dirty looks back.  Greg seemed to be really uncomfortable, but I think that if we had more of our friends there he would be ok.  Charlene's birthday is coming up and she wants us to go back there with her, so we will make it as much fun as we possibly can.  Right?

P.S.~ Was that you on the grass?

Signed up to volunteer at Inside Out!  Exciting!  It's going to be so sad without Lay here this year though.  :o(  I signed us up for 4 shifts... so hopefully we will be able to see all of the films we chose.  Free t-shirt and tickets!  Woooo!!  It's even worth running into small-talky people.  Get your tickets early before they sell out.

Sara and I went to "Family Day" at U of T with Sean... couldn't stop laughing.  It's nice how they feed bullshit to the frosh kids, while trying to sound smart and cool.  The guy even got a racist + sexist + ageist remark or two in there!  Go U of T!  I can't help but feel sorry for them.

I think it was Weed Day at Queen's Park today as well.  If not, I wouldn't have known the difference.  Holy crap.

Speaking of crap...

OCAD grads are showcasing their work this week.  This means tents of reduced-price art supplies from Aboveground, hordes of pomos, highschool class trips of wannabes (wanna be what?), and the usual Queen Street West crowd bringing it a bit north to pretend that they understand.  I'm not even going to try.

My mom's coming downtown tomorrow for Mother's Day.  I think we're going to take it east to Ends and Aida's.  We haven't been there in a while and the weather is nice enough.  And plus, I think she needs to get out and away for a bit.

The month is slowly getting busier.  But not much warmer.  

My dad is officially moving to Saskatoon for 1 + 1/2 or 2 years... I am thinking Corner Gas.  Although, he made it through 6 months in Dallas, so he will be fine.  It's just funny to picture a quiet British man amongst the cowfolk.  I will finally be able to go west after repeatedly venturing east.  I am happy for him (happy FOR him... thanks, Sean! :oP ), it will be a change of scenery and even better pay.  Somehow I fit into the goodness as I am getting a new laptop out of the deal.  Everyone is worried about Dylan though.  He'll be stuck with my brother, who is always locked in his room.  Maybe my mom will agree to take him.  We'll see.

Off to U of T.

I left my jacket on the Greyhound. I was sitting on it. Sara and I were too busy beating each other during our U-Haul game to notice that I left it when we got up to ask the driver to stop. I remembered that I had a jacket as soon as the bus pulled away. After attempting to call the bus terminal several times and having nobody pick up, we ventured downtown on the Guelph city bus (which actually had a nice driver this time, compared to all of the usual incompetent assholes). They have recently changed the routes, so we got off a few stops early. To our disgust, we found ourselves right in front of the Cornerstone (a.k.a. Guelph Lesbo Central). I kid you not, we peeped into the always-steamy window and counted a good 3 dread-heads. And that unmistakable stench that poured from the walls. *shudder* The lesbo smell. You know what I'm talking about... every lesbian bar, and lesbo, smells like it. Except me and Sara :o) Anyhoo... We got to the terminal and the dude said that the bus had gone to Kitchener and that the driver would be back in Guelph sometime that evening. I left my contact info and we went outside to catch the city bus back to Sara's. We had time to kill, so we wandered up and down the street looking at restaurants and stores. And trying not to breathe in the pot that passers-by were smoking. Sara told me a cute story about Tegan and Sara staying at that hotel and the Pita Pit across the street. I was baffled that Frank & Stein's wasn't a family hot dog joint. The same bus driver was driving the bus, and she looked the other way when we used the same transfer for our return trip. Thanks for not causing us to be stranded. The dude called Sara's house before we got home to say that my jacket had arrived. Sean drove us to the terminal the next day and I retrieved it. On the Greyhound there was a German couple sitting beside us (we could tell before they even sat down that they were German... the tight shirt, etc.) About half-way to Guelph, the guy whips out a tupperware container full of apple crumble. I couldn't believe it!
Monika would have been proud. It didn't look as good as my pie-cake though. We sat down with Sean and talked about living arrangements. I think we have a solid plan. Sara and I extended our lease until August, which is a good first step. Now to find a bigger place.

You Are a Dreaming Soul
Your vivid emotions and imagination takes you awy from this world So much so that you tend to live in your head most of the time You have great dreams and ambitions that could be the envy of all... But for you, following through with your dreams is a bit difficult You are charming, endearing, and people tend to love you. Forgiving and tolerant, you see the world through rose colored glasses. Underneath it all, you have a ton of passion that you hide from others. Always hopeful, you tend to expect positive outcomes in your life. Souls you are most compatible with: Newborn Soul, Prophet Soul, and Traveler Soul
What Kind of Soul Are You?

Had an odd assortment of days recently.

My exam on Tuesday went alright I think, there were a few ridiculous essay questions on things that nobody took notes on.  I know this because our 8 am 3-hour long class never bothered to.  Yes, this includes me.  It is definitely one of those schemes to bring the class average down... *mumbles*.  Not to mention that I hate writing exams in the GYM!  I went to hand the thing in and my prof told me that it was a pleasure having me in his class.  Aww.  I will miss him... Ryerson needs more profs like that.  He always made me smile and was fun to talk to.  Hire more young smart cute bald black gay men, Ryerson!

Sara and I went to my dad's house yesterday.  We took Dylan for a walk and raided the fridge.  My brother and dad looked happy to see us.  I made dinner and then we watched tv as usual.  My brother bought a black '97 BMW in the past few weeks (dumbass, my dad is now teaching him to drive a stick shift.  He's driving my dad's car in the meantime).  My dad drove us home in it and it's super nice... leather interior, sunroof, 6 cd changer, etc.  

Meanwhile, back at the ranch... (who is it that always used to say that?)

The fighting continues and there is no solution in sight.  I am to think about it and try to fix it.  It's much more difficult than it sounds ,with no starting point to push off from.  

I'm supposed to be at a lunch right now, but I don't feel like making small talk and I'm not too fond of the venue anyway.  Blah. 

On with the job search...

Helped Sara sort through boxes in Guelph this weekend before her family sells the house. :o( I will miss it. I got to see lots of stuff from her childhood (most of it was Monika's). She found some old postcards from Julia. She hasn't googled her yet, but we'll see where she is and what she's doing and if I will be abandoned. Haha. I'm soooo bored. Going through pics on my computer... I suppose this is how I feel:
Kinnie. I need more of your good songs. Remember that time you played Lee's and your beats kept skipping? I had the strangest dream yesterday. Well, I don't know if it's strange or completely true. Hmm. I like to think that it's strange. So I am finally finished working at school! It has been a looong year. I'm not officially celebrating until the coordinator lunch on Thursday is over. And maybe not even then... I'm sure my boss will find some loose ends for me to tie up. My last exam is on Tuesday. It isn't too hard though. I need a new job. I haven't even had a break from school yet and I'm bored. Blaaaaaahhhhh. You can do lots of things when you have money. P.S.~ "Shiiit noooo!"

So I got my first choice placement for next year.  It's a supercool agency.  I had my interview this morning and was taken on a tour of the building and programs there.  I got to meet all of the participants and get a feel for whether I want to do my placement there next year (by the end it had been set...yes).  The lady who interviewed me sounded a bit mean on the phone (and even through email), but she was really nice and she did most (all) of the talking.  I think she asked me a total of 1 question other than administrative stuff.  She talked for an hour, but it allowed me to get a really good sense of the services and programs that they have, and by the time we walked around it was pretty much exactly how I imagined it.  It's going to be really challenging, but I like the teamwork setting and it has ALL of the positive aspects of an agency that I can think of and have learned about.  Well, other than the fact that it's a poor agency that is losing some funding.  That's a shitty deal.  But I will be working there for FREE 2 days a week for 2 semesters.  I'm a bit nervous about asking if I can miss 2 weeks to rendez-vous with my family in Florida and make them up at the end of my placement.  If not, that's really sucky but ok.  It will save me from the akwardness of "no, Grampa, I'm not 'courting' any boys or planning to get married without inviting you".  Ah, the joys of having most of your relatives in other continents.      

Everything's comin' up roses.  Slowly. 

*Sigh*  Kathy, please don't mess it up!

I put up my LomoHome today... it's quite boring at this point but hopefully it will brighten up with each new roll. http://www.lomohomes.com/mmm_fajitas Today's LomoHome of the day is rhythmntruth! I thought that was super cool because I am a big fan. I finally got a call from social work about my placement for next year. I actually set up an interview with my first choice agency! I'm excited, but the lady intimidated me when she said that my interview would be when clients will be there. I guess I am glad to know that ahead of time though. Of the crappy selection in the 3rd year binders, I found ONE place where I wouldn't mind working (it's name is promising: C.O.R.E. - Centre for Opportunities, Respect and Empowerment), I have some sort of formal background working with the client population (adults with disabilities), and it's within walking distance of my apartment. Wish me luck. Sara and I had breakfast on the balcony today:
While we were eating, a bird flew across the table and into our windowpane. It was a little stunned, but flew away as fast as it could. Poor thing. Sara almost had a heart attack. It nearly flew into her head. Poor thing. :oP

I developed my first roll of lomos today. There were a few good ones, a few funny ones and a few boring ones. I choose to show you this one first, entitled "Shifty-eyed: I've been found out"
It had to be done. You can't have a fun camera like this and not try the shifty eye. Went out with Gilo, Surinder and Sara for dinner and finally got to see Gilo's place. It's super nice, and Golam is soooo cute. I also finally got to meet Leanne and her boyfriend. They seem very nice. Gilo and I went to Dutch Dreams for ice cream. Mmmmm. Gilo spoiled me by taking me shopping and giving me some presents that she had stashed at her place from past birthdays and Christmases. She got me a really cool necklace, a bunch of cool Body Shop stuff, and a book that I wanted to read (The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time by Mark Haddon). I got my first exam out of the way yesterday... I think it went well. You can never tell with vague essay questions though. And a 70 year old prof. Ah, Bernie. I finally handed in that damn social policy paper too. I found out that Bobby from my graduating class in high school (and Ryerson) died in his sleep on Monday. That's so sad. He was going to graduate from civil engineering this June. Such a good kid. Monique's brother was the guy who was shot at, and hit, this week at Yonge and Dundas too. Craig's good friend was killed last month. Another guy was killed in Lay's old building. What the fuck's going on at Ryerson (and with the limited degrees of separation)? It deeply saddens and frightens me and as a result I lose sleep.

The microwave died today :o(

I got my camera in the mail on Friday... friggin customs charge of over $15.  Mehhhh.  I'm almost finished my first roll though.  Everyone is very curious to see how the pics will turn out.  I'll scan 'em and post a few if any are worthy (and if the freaky Guelph house/midget riding school/junkyard didn't taint the film).     

Still haven't done a long overdue paper.  I guess waiting for it to do itself is not a viable option.

Monika went back to Germany on Sunday.  :o(  I really hope Sara will get a chance to visit her this summer.  Maybe I will be able to go too!  :oD

Hmmm what else?  It's been a busy few weeks but nothing incredibly exciting to write about.  Or is there?  Hmmm.  I spent lots of time with Sara and her peoples, which was nice.  Made a giant pie-cake, roasted marshmallows, played foosball...  

We had 2 buffets in one weekend!  Mmmm... Mandarin and Golden Griddle.  Gregory! came with us to Mandarin after crashing at my place on Thursday night.  We went to Crews again, with a record of 10 people at our table.  Good times  :o)   

I had my last class today.  My first exam is on Thursday, and I actually got something out of the review class for once.  I'm mad that my exams are so spread out... I finish on the 26th.  Bah.  I suppose I can enjoy this beautiful weather in between studying and writing exams.  

It's starting to smell like summer and it's getting a bit sweaty already.  I wish it could stay cool and breezy all year.  

Another random post.  Sorry  :oP

How much do I love this song?! (Thanks Gregory!) It makes me think of happy people playing in the sun. I still haven't adjusted to the spring transition from random snow to random thunderstorms. I never really noticed it when I lived in North York, but since I'm so close to the lake now, the crack of thunder is much louder. Not to mention the cheap windows in my highrise building rattling. The weather is seriously different here. I didn't think a half-hour subway ride would divide climates so much! Then again, the amount of green up there and the lack of it down here is quite a contrast. I'm going up there now to pick up a cheque from my dad's house and visit for a bit. Maybe take the dog for a walk. Then he'll be mad at me again when I leave. :o(

Of all weekends, we have to lose an hour from THIS one.  Still so much to do.  Meh, I can deal with it... it means Sara will come home one hour sooner.  And also that little factor of the longer daylight days.  Yes, that.

I watched 'Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind' today (I had an urge to go shopping yesterday (how odd of me.) and ended up using my HMV gift certificates to buy two things I had never heard/seen before (how odd of me.).  The movie was alright, it seemed to drag on but the end was kinda sweet.  The annoying actors weren't too annoying.  Sara's right though, it's not a movie you can watch over and over again like some of our favourites.    

The other thing I bought is 'Let It Die' (Feist).  I finally got to hear the song Sara dedicates to me... aww.  I'd heard it before, but if you know me you know that I'm horrible with labels (names, titles, etc.). I have listened to the entire album maybe 20 times since I bought it.  It's short, but still.  I haven't bought a CD in a really long time.  Not that I pirate a lot either... my mp3s are ancient.  Something new(er) is refreshing.  And I can't really say that I like some songs more than others...diverse yet solid.  Just how I like it.

Where it all sprang from:  we were watching Vicki Gabereau (why?) and couldn't figure out who was on.  (See, my sub-par labeling skills at work.).  We got to 'Montreal pomo' (the best kind, sophisticated and genuine, unlike 'Toronto pomo' and the various subgenres therein - (tangent: the flip flops have officially been brought out already, which is ok as long as the fuzzy (or non-fuzzy for that matter) pom pom boots are gone) - who defeat the purpose of 'being weird for the sake of being weird' by spending $400 on clothes that quite possibly came straight from the dumpster.  And WHY does the street always smell like incense?!  Ahem.  'Montreal pomo', although she's not from Montreal, turned out to be Feist.  There ya go.  The point.

Note to self: 3 more weeks and I'm out of the grip of the machine!  Then 2 more years of sneak-into-class, leave-as-soon-as-possible like all of those mofos who don't have a clue.  :o)  Ignorance!

Was confronted and verbally attacked by the boss yesterday... brought IRRELEVANT issues into it.  Always appreciated.  3 more weeks.

The other side of the coin is that I'm falling in love all over again.  I can forget about petty things in my life and appreciate the happiness that comes from that instead.

Onward and upward!

Sara just came home again!  :o)

Gonna go... I'll write about the goodness later.

:o)

I received a call from Sara that has left me worried.  I hope everything's ok over there.  I went to Timmy's to get some snacks for the long night ahead.  I opted for an XL triple triple and I cashed in my free donut rim for a toffee glazed.  Mmmm.  The lady who works there looks kinda like Marina from The L Word (Mmmm.) and she looked at me as though I was crazy when I ordered.  Speaking of crazy, on my way over, I remembered my recent conversation with Monika about OCAD looking like a children's mental institution (at night). (Nope, in the day too).  It's really true!  Well, from my building's view anyway.  Think about it: a raised level of brightly-coloured rooms with tiny coloured windows on crayon-looking posts with purple lights illuminating the damn thing.  

Freaks. 

My headache is gone but I will surely crash later.  Ah, caffeine and sugar.  Yes, I am all about the instant gratification and not so much about ultimate consequences.  

We'll see if my theory that all of the good prizes are in the big cups is true or not.  I'll keep you posted.  ;o)  

I'm excited about the sex toys workshop on Thursday.  I know that *some* of you aren't so enthused.  The food will make up for it.  It's for guys and girls this time!  Always a good time.  For me anyway.

Just spent nearly 2 hours slumped in my chair reading backblogs.  At some point it got dark and I turned my lamp on.  The same song has been playing the whole time.  Didn't even notice.  I WILL make my life more interesting and challenging.   

Now I'm hungry and I don't want to eat perogies again.  Let's see how much I have in my account (can I be lazy?):

Oh my.  Perogies it is.  I'll spice 'em up (somehow).

I really miss Sara.  I have a paper to write tonight, but if she came home I would spend time with her instead.  Not in my usual procrastinatory way, but in a "grabby-grabby, miss you" way.  :o(

Greg and I ALMOST got a good deal at the Oakham Cafe today.  No such luck.  Karma will reign.  One of these days!  *shakes her fist*

Off to "eat" and write.

It started off so well
They said we made a perfect pair
I clothed myself in your glory and your love
How I loved you
How I cried...
The years of care and loyalty
Were nothing but a sham it seems
The years belie we lived a lie
I love you till I die
Save me save me save me
I can't face this life alone
Save me save me save me...
I'm naked and I'm far from home

The slate will soon be clean
I'll erase the memories
To start again with somebody new
Was it all wasted
All that love?...
I hang my head and I advertise
A soul for sale or rent
I have no heart I'm cold inside
I have no real intent
Save me save me save me
I can't face this life alone
Save me save me save me...
I'm naked and I'm far from home

Each night I cry I still believe the lie
I love you till I die
Save me save me save me
Don't let me face my life alone
Save me save me ooh...
I'm naked and I'm far from home

~ Queen

*sigh*

Too much drag for one week.  Pretty unoriginal stuff for the first warm weekend, when the lines are literally half a block up the street to get in.  Disappointment.  At least I met Sako.  He's a cutie.  Then he left.  We tried to go to 501 to see some other queens too, but that was just creepy.  I've never seen one actually sing before.  We hightailed it out of there and went our separate ways home.

My ass is staying home all day tomorrow and reading.  Ugh.  Must must must.  

I hope Sara is coming home tomorrow, I could use some good normalness.  Probably not, which I understand, because Monika's there.   

I kinda feel bad for not spending time with my parents for Easter.  Well, nothing was going on at my mom's anyway... Rob's still getting better.  And probably not at my dad's either.  But still.

It will be a busy-shitty-crazy-stressful-sleepless-crabby-looooong week.  Tim Horton's will cash in.  Thankfully it is Rrrrrrrroll up the rrrrrrrrim time and I am bound to win more goodies with the amount of coffee I will ingest.     

I will try to make the best of it.  :o)  I have found coping mechanisms... now if I can only deploy them without the procrastination factor.  Hmmm.

Great news!!!  I found out that I have Lomo connections!  :o)  So much for spending a fortune.  We'll see what kind of a deal I can strike up.  Oh Ebay, how you have screwed me.  But I shall screw you back by re-selling.    

Speaking of Ebay, Sara finally found 'Show Me Love' at a decent price!  Woo-hoo!!!  Best movie ever.  Well, one of 'em.  And also 'The Adventures of Two Girls in Love' for an extra $3.  Sweet.  :o) 

So exciting!!!

We had Good Friday dinner in Guelph (8 people!). It was lots of fun.  I made dessert, as usual, and we watched crappy movies and played cards.  I like it when everyone is together again.  I hitched a ride with Martin + Alia to the airport and then TTCed it home.  Wanted delicious beef soup again but it was closed.  :o(  Settled for vegetable stew from another place... pretty good, but not the same.

I finally got some change for laundry.  You will all be able to stand within a smaller radius of me fairly soon.  *Looks at the heaping baskets of dirty clothes*.  Fairly.
Woah.  That last entry was unnecessarily random.  Sorry!  My head hurts too.

So it's been a few days.  

Took some time away to get stuff done!  So shoot me.  :oP

Done lots of drinking ...er... thinking in the past few weeks and shared some thoughts.  I don't mean to be intrusive.  It made me feel better.  I feel better.  :o)  Thanks everyone.

Going out with Gregory! to Crews again tonight.  Drag queens always cheer me up.

Just as she goes I want her to stay.  :o( 

2 papers, a test and job hunting to catch up on.  My "long weekend" will hopefully be put to good use.  

My camera is being shipped from Boston!  CAN'T WAIT!!!  Coolest thing ever.  Thanks, tax return!  ;o)

Went on a date with my gf on Tuesday.  We had a great dinner and went to see The Ring 2.  Good times  :o)  We should do that more often.

Went to Crews.  After leaving to get pizza and say goodbye, the door lady told me that I had to wait in line again to get back in.  Even though my jacket was inside.  When I got to the front of the line, she wanted to see I.D., and of course, it was in my jacket inside.  I showed her my coat check ticket.  She told me to take my I.D. out of my jacket next time I went outside so I could get back in.  Great system.  I've been going there for what... 3 years now... and still get carded every single time.  Fuggers.

Tango went through a stage when my friends and I went there every weekend and got trashed and flirted the place up (well, at least THEY did).  Then it went dead and we didn't go as much.  Then a wave of young teenage faces came in (barely 19) and we avoided the place all together.  Apparently, the crowd has changed dramatically again.  Hot people!  An equal ratio of hot to creepy.  There were also a few cute couples.  It's nice to see people flirt with each other (I haven't been out in a while!).  Creepy woman checked me out. *shudder*.  Cute girl smiled at me, I smiled back.  She moved to stand beside me and bumped into my arm and apologized (ask me about it, I'll draw you a diagram).  Real smooth.  Yes you, green-shirted girl.  The music stopped, lights came on, and I retrieved my jacket from the coat check.  The girl who works there called me sweetie and asked me how I was.  I was nice back.  I walked home... we had nice weather tonight.  

I'm glad Gregory! came home early and his friends came out tonight.  You guys missed Robyn Loren doing Cher!  AND you missed HEAVENLY DOING GARBAGE!!!  # 1 Crush!  *dries her underwear*  Ewwww I'm totally kidding!  Sorry Greg.

Why do they have ads for ManLine in the women's stalls?  *baffled*  There was also a faded ballpoint pen note about how you need to work 912 hours to receive worker's compensation or something like that as well though.  People are drunkards.  

Fin.

I woke up this morning feeling rather crappy.  I had that sick feeling in my throat and had no energy.  I had jasmine tea and headed off to the march + rally.  On my way, I thought about Greg and sent him all of my best wishes for the day.  

Met up with the RyePride/SAC crew and of course, it had to be THE WINDIEST DAY EVER when we needed to carry a long banner.  Ugh.  That pocket knife really comes in handy a lot... I made some windholes and we were off.  The student groups met up at Dundas Square and marched over to Nathan Phillips Square to join the rest.  There were a few speakers there to set the tone for the day.  Politicians, former U.S. soldiers who refused to murder innocent civilians - and their families who are seeking refugee status here in Canada, and a 14 year old Iraqi girl.  I liked her speech the best.

We ditched the march when the cops had to separate the Ukrainian demonstration from the Troops Out Now! marchers.  I caught up with the march again as it was pulling into Nathan Phillips Square to end.  I passed on the activities and went for some take-out udon instead.  It warmed me up.  :o)  Mmmm.

I made brownies, and I couldn't wait for them to cool off before I started to eat them, so they were crumbly but still yummy.

Gregory! came home and we are going out to Crews with his roommates.  

It has been a good weekend.

Mad props to Greg for all of his work:

"Thank you everyone on your help!

Today, I contacted the Port Perry Star, which was very interested in doing a
story, as soon as the reporter comes off of holidays on Monday.

Bruce Rogers, the esteemed journalist, author and 2004 candidate for the NDP in
Clarington-Scugog-Uxbridge voiced his support, and is graciously writing a
letter into the Port Perry Star about the matter

I canvassed approximately 50 houses, and received far more support from the
community, of all age groups, than I did opposition.  I collected over two dozen
signatures, and a handful of the pamphlets (many people threw them out already,
naturally), and I'll be going around the community some more tomorrow.

My main concern is, as always, the community, especially those that will be
effected by the outcome of this bill (be it personally, or through a loved one),
and the backlash that people will face from all the homophobic rhetoric and
propaganda, especially in areas such as the schools, that I know all too well. 
I'm trying very hard to put a human face of support from within this community,
but there is no way I could even canvass a fraction of Port Perry, let alone the
rest of the area, on my own.  Please, if anyone can provide help in that area,
as the feedback has been great, I'd appreciate it.

Thank you so much for all your support and help, I wouldn't be able to do
anything without your support.

In Solidarity,
Gregory Allan Evans"

:o)

I dragged (ha! wow I'm clever.) a friend out to Sneaky Dee's tonight for Genderfukt!.  It was such a great show... the best drag show I have ever seen, in fact.  Many steps up from the regular Wednesday night shows at Tango.  I didn't even mind paying to get in.  I never really took to drag king shows before.  I was always more fascinated by drag queens.  After all, many lesbians are genderbending in the way they dress anyway, but gay men... not so much.  (I was told by a friend that back in the day, lesbians would do drag in dresses.  Now that's genderbending if you ask me).  Anyway, the thought and artistry that went into this show was impressive.  I wanted to go last time as well, but there was a blizzard and I decided to stay home instead.  Now I'm sorry I missed it, and I will definitely be at the next show.  It was good to see some old friends and familiar faces, as I have been a hermit lately and as you all know, a loner.  :oP

Time for bed.

In the office, in a deserted building, at 6pm on a Friday.  Making up hours.  Look at me working!  

I ended up in Guelph for St.Patrick's Day after all and didn't really drink.  Only one of us did, and that was quite funny... should have done the permanent marker thing.  Next time.  Muah-ha-ha.  I finally slept well for once.  

The march and rally are tomorrow.  I hope it doesn't rain.  :o(  If it does, the banner will be heavy.  But still held high.

I must update myself about what's going on with the family and friends.  Also must start studying.

Going home now... this place is creepy when nobody's around and still smelly.

Peace out.

Got stuck in a barricade with a bunch of drunken engineers today.  They even brought their pitchers of green beer outside.  Bless them.  I think I have lost a good 15% of my hearing though.  At least we will get the hint if there is ever actually a fire.

I finally got rid of those damn bins in the office.  We shoved all of the contents into the co-ord office for now, cleaned up a bit, and rearranged furniture to try to figure out a good arrangement.  It looks like a living room right now, if you imagine the monitor is a tv.  It would be nice to get bookshelves though, you know, for those things...oh yeah, books.  

The 8am presentation went well, I think.  It was one of those presentations that you can't remember for the life of you what you discussed afterward.  Prof said that we did a "very good job" though.  Meh.

Grabbed some lunch from Oakham and gave a tip, although it was takeout, because I confused the poor girl.  She was clearly not familiar with the concept of people showing their student cards to get the student discount.  

Curse you, Cleve LaPinder and associates!  Doesn't it occur to you that you are disrupting other peoples' lives as well?  It ain't gonna happen! Dah.

Gonna call mom... she wants to go for udon again.  Mmmm.  How I love you HoSU.  

Later: drinky drinky.

I designed and painted a banner for Saturday today. It finally feels like a community in the new building, having spent most of the day with coordinators from the other CSGs.  With only about 3 "real" weeks left in the school year, it's a shame that this feeling originates so late.  

I have a presentation at 8 am tomorrow.  Joy.  Gettin trashed afterward (St. Patrick's Day...yes...good excuse).  Went to the airport today as well.  We had to go to Terminal 3 though, not 1.  The flight was actually early!  Good timing.  I took a different bus back to the subway... and it did take like an hour.  That meant that I got to see a part of the city I usually don't see.  Passed by the Canadian Tire at Dufferin.  R.I.P. car.

Winter is officially ending in 4 days.  :o(  Farewell, odd sensation of having frostbitten ears and sweaty pits at the same time.  My mom's call on the extreme weather jacket proved to be a bit much.  At least I didn't wear a windbreaker all winter, like some people.  Ahem.  I really don't like summer though.  Apart from the bright colours and having less things to carry.  All I'm really looking forward to is having a break from school and maybe going back to Wonderland to test out our theory again.

Happy St.Patrick's Day. Party at our place.  Byob.
